text: I'm working on an experimental package that may ultimately be absorbed into another package. Is that a good reason to not register it? Are outdated packages ever removed from the registry? I'd like to avoid potentially confusing users if there are two packages with similar names but one is discontinued.

elements.text: I'm working on an experimental package that may ultimately be absorbed into another package. Is that a good reason to not register it? Are outdated packages ever removed from the registry? I'd like to avoid potentially confusing users if there are two packages with similar names but one is discontinued.

text:
While things are never and will never (exceptions aside) be deleted from registry at some point we might have the option to `unlist` them s that they don’t tab-complete, and maybe don’t block the name from being used for something else, and maybe show a warning on install.

<https://github.com/JuliaLang/Pkg.jl/issues/2194>

them s that they don’t tab-complete, and maybe don’t block the name from being used for something else, and maybe show a warning on install.

text: I think yanking all versions would have the same effect?  (just annoying to yank every single version)
